conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab, analyze the forces on both the wooden block P and the board ab.
The block P has a mass m.
The gravitational force acting on P is mg.
The normal force N1 exerted by the board ab on P is equal to mg because the block is in equilibrium vertically.
The kinetic frictional force f1 acting on P due to the board ab is μ2 N1 = μ2 mg.
The board ab has a mass M.
The gravitational force acting on ab is Mg.
The normal force N2 exerted by the ground on ab is equal to the total weight of the system, which is (M + m)g.
The kinetic frictional force f2 acting on ab due to the ground is μ1 N2 = μ1 (M + m)g.
Since the board ab remains stationary, the net horizontal force on ab must be zero.
The only horizontal force acting on ab is the frictional force f1 exerted by P on ab, which is μ2 mg.
The frictional force exerted by the ground on ab must be equal in magnitude and opposite in direction to f1 to maintain equilibrium.
The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is μ2 mg.
